title: Learning Path: ExitCode 25
ai_summary: ExitCode 25 typically indicates a Build Worker connection failure during packaging. This often occurs due to network issues, firewall blocking, or Unreal Build Tool (UBT) process crashes.
ai_what_you_learn: Identify the root cause by checking the full log output in Saved/Logs
Check Windows Firewall settings for UnrealBuildTool.exe
Verify no antivirus is blocking UE5 build processes
Clear the Intermediate and Saved folders to force a clean rebuild

steps.title: Step 1: Understand ExitCode 25
steps.description:
ExitCode 25 is a Build Worker failure that occurs when the Unreal Build Tool loses connection to its worker processes. This can happen due to system resource constraints, firewall interference, or corrupted build caches.

üëâ **Action:** Open your project's Saved/Logs folder and find the most recent packaging log file. Search for 'Error' or 'ExitCode' to find the specific failure point.
steps.action: Open your project's Saved/Logs folder and find the most recent packaging log file. Search for 'Error' or 'ExitCode' to find the specific failure point.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video covers the complete packaging process and common failure points.

‚è±Ô∏è **When to watch:** Start at 10:00 where packaging settings are discussed. (10 minutes)

steps.title: Step 2: Check System Issues
steps.description:
ExitCode 25 is often caused by system-level interference with the build process. Antivirus software and Windows Firewall frequently block UBT worker processes.

üëâ **Action:** 1. Add your UE5 installation folder to Windows Defender exclusions. 2. Temporarily disable any third-party antivirus. 3. Check Windows Firewall for blocked UnrealBuildTool.exe entries.
steps.action: Add your UE5 installation folder to Windows Defender exclusions. Temporarily disable any third-party antivirus. Check Windows Firewall for blocked UnrealBuildTool.exe entries.

content.title: Fixing Common UE5 Packaging Errors
content.description:
**Why this helps:** Covers common packaging issues including system-level causes.

‚è±Ô∏è **When to watch:** Watch from the beginning to understand common error patterns. (15 minutes)

steps.title: Step 3: Clean Rebuild
steps.description:
Corrupted intermediate files can cause ExitCode 25. A clean rebuild often resolves the issue.

üëâ **Action:** 1. Close Unreal Editor completely. 2. Delete the 'Intermediate' and 'Saved' folders in your project directory. 3. Delete the 'DerivedDataCache' folder (in AppData/Local/UnrealEngine). 4. Reopen your project and try packaging again.
steps.action: Close Unreal Editor. Delete Intermediate and Saved folders. Delete DerivedDataCache. Reopen project and package again.

content.title: How to Package Your Game - Unreal Engine 5 Tutorial
content.description:
**Why this helps:** Step-by-step tutorial on clean packaging workflow.

‚è±Ô∏è **When to watch:** Watch the troubleshooting section around 8:00. (10 minutes)

steps.title: Step 4: Prevent Future Issues
steps.description:
Set up your development environment to avoid ExitCode 25 in the future.

üëâ **Action:** 1. Permanently add UE5 folders to antivirus exclusions. 2. Package builds regularly during development to catch issues early. 3. Use source control (Git) to revert problematic changes. 4. Keep UE5 and Visual Studio updated.
steps.action: Add UE5 folders to antivirus exclusions. Package regularly during development. Use version control. Keep tools updated.
